# bounces

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that controls whether the scroll view bounces past the edge of content and back again.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var bounces: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the scroll view bounces when it encounters a boundary of the content. Bouncing visually indicates that scrolling has reached an edge of the content. If the value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], scrolling stops immediately at the content boundary without bouncing. The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

Setting [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIScrollView/bounces] is equivalent to setting both [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIScrollView/bouncesHorizontally] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIScrollView/bouncesVertically] to the same value. To set different behavior for the two axes, set those properties to distinct values.

## Configuring the scroll view

- **isScrollEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether scrolling is enabled.
- **isDirectionalLockEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether scrolling is disabled in a particular direction.
- **isPagingEnabled**: A Boolean value that determines whether paging is enabled for the scroll view.
- **scrollsToTop**: A Boolean value that controls whether the scroll-to-top gesture is enabled.
- **bouncesHorizontally**: A Boolean value that determines whether the scroll view bounces when it reaches the ends of its horizontal axis.
- **bouncesVertically**: A Boolean value that determines whether the scroll view bounces when it reaches the ends of its vertical axis.
- **alwaysBounceVertical**: A Boolean value that determines whether bouncing always occurs when vertical scrolling reaches the end of the content.
- **alwaysBounceHorizontal**: A Boolean value that determines whether bouncing always occurs when horizontal scrolling reaches the end of the content view.
